_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Urethane and Other Foam Product (except Polystyrene) Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



Pacific Urethanes is committed to operating in a manner that is safe for our employees, the community, and the environment. As part of this commitment, Pacific Urethanes has established a Risk Management Program to help the company identify and communicate risks associated with our operations. Reasonable controls have been installed to prevent accidental releases from occurring. Site specific plans for emergency response have been developed to reduce the effects upon our employees and the general public in the highly unlikely event of a release of hazardous materials from the facility. 



2. Facility and Regulated Chemical Description



Pacific Urethanes has developed a risk management program to address the EPA Risk Management Plan (RMP) Program requirements (40 CFR 68) due to the onsite process containing a regulated chemical above its threshold quantity.

The regulated chemical, Toluene Diisocyanate (TDI), with a CAS # 26471-62-5, is present at the facility in quantities above its 10,000-pound threshold.



3. Accidental Release Prevention Program



Pacific Urethanes is dedicated to continuous improvement of its environmental, health and safety program. Pacific Urethanes' employees have been trained and provided with detailed information concerning their job duties and chemicals stored onsite. Employees have also been trained on the facility's Emergency Reporting Program.



4. Five-Year Accident History



There have been no RMP applicable releases of toxic materials in the past five (5) years. 



5. Emergency Response Program



Pacific Urethanes has developed an Emergency Reporting Program that has been coordinated with the City of Ontario Fire Department. The Emergency Reporting Program details roles and responsibilities, procedures, and corrective measures to be used in the event of an emergency that could threaten human health or the environment. 

Employees have been trained and are fa

miliar with the contents of the plan, as well as their roles and responsibilities as specified by the plan.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Pacific Urethanes works with employees, vendors and consultants to continually improve the safety of the process. In the event that Pacific Urethanes management identifies additional measures to further improve the safety of the process, they will be implemented in a timely manner.
